priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Vital Signs Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120536

self.title: CDISC SEND Vital Signs Test Code Terminology

definition: The name given to the test code that analyzes a vital sign in nonclinical studies.
name: SEND Vital Signs Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Vital Signs Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: The property of a body or region of space that determines whether or not there will be a net flow of heat into it or out of it from a neighboring body or region and in which direction (if any) the heat will flow, perceptible by living organism as a somatic sensation of cold or heat. It is a measure of the average translational kinetic energy associated with the disordered microscopic motion of atoms and molecules. Temperature is measured in one of the three standard temperature scales: Celsius, Kelvin, and Fahrenheit. (NCI)
